body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

Create file `t.ps1`:

```powershell
@'
param($A, $B)

"`$A: [$A]"
"`$B: [$B]"
'@ > t.ps1
```

Then invoke it as follows:

```powershell
pwsh -nop -file t.ps1 -A foo -B "-:"
```

The problem is that _any_ combination of an initial `-` followed by a `:` anywhere in the remainder of the argument causes the argument to be misinterpreted as a
`-<parameter-name>:<value>`-style argument, i.e. as a _named_ argument that includes its target parameter name, instead of as a verbatim string value that binds to argument `-B`.

It is debatable what the correct behavior should be if the argument actually looks like a valid parameter(-name)-argument combination, such as `"-C:bar"` (note that on Unix PowerShell won't be able to tell whether quoting was originally used or not, which from within PowerShell serves to disambiguate between `-C:bar` (parameter-argument) and `'-C:bar'` (argument only). If it is `"-C :bar"` (note the space), it should definitely be an argument only.


### Expected behavior

```console
$A: [foo]
$B: [-:]
```


### Actual behavior

An error occurs, because `-:` isn't recognized as an _argument_ for parameter `-B`.


### Error details

```console
t.ps1: Missing an argument for parameter 'B'. Specify a parameter of type 'System.Object' and try again.
```


### Environment data

```powershell
PowerShell Core 7.2.0
```


### Visuals

_No response_
title: CLI: -File misinterprets any argument that starts with `-` (hyphen) and contains a `:` (colon) as a parameter-name-value combination (named argument)
